page.title: 07THE DRIFT - A BRIDLEWAY
page.content: The Drift is the bridleway that links Dry Drayton and Bar Hill.When we looked at some nineteenth and early twentieth century maps of our area we found that The Drift used to go right through to Longstanton,another village about two miles east of Bar Hill.There used to be a farm called Willow Farm on the site of what is now Bar Hill.(The old farmhouse still stands in the centre of the village).A toll bar was erected across the bridleway near the farmhouse. Eventually the name of the farm was changed to Bar Farm.We believe that this is where the"Bar"in the village's name came from.The village is also built on about the only hill for miles around _ we do in fact have a trig station at the village's highest point _ so we feel that it is for these two reasons that the village got its name.
